title: Electromagnetic Spectrum: Properties, Applications, and Effects
subject: Physics

questions.question: Which property is common to all electromagnetic waves in a vacuum?
questions.explanation: All electromagnetic waves travel at the speed of light (3 × 10⁸ m/s) in a vacuum.

questions.question: Which region of the EM spectrum has the longest wavelength?
questions.explanation: Radio waves have the longest wavelengths in the electromagnetic spectrum.

questions.question: Which of these is a typical use of microwaves?
questions.explanation: Microwaves are used in mobile phone communication, microwave ovens, and satellite TV.

questions.question: Which EM wave is commonly used in optical fibers for telecommunications?
questions.explanation: Visible light is used in optical fibers for high-speed data transmission.

questions.question: What is the main hazard of over-exposure to ultraviolet radiation?
questions.explanation: UV radiation can ionise cells and cause DNA damage, leading to skin cancer.

questions.question: Which EM wave is used in bank note authentication?
questions.explanation: UV light reveals security features on bank notes that are invisible under normal light.

questions.question: Which type of electromagnetic wave has the highest frequency?
questions.explanation: Gamma rays have the highest frequency (and shortest wavelength) in the EM spectrum.

questions.question: What is a common use of infrared radiation?
questions.explanation: Infrared is used in thermal imaging cameras, remote controllers, and indoor alarms.

questions.question: Which statement about electromagnetic waves is correct?
options: They require a medium to travel
They travel faster in glass than in vacuum
questions.explanation: Electromagnetic waves are transverse waves that can travel through a vacuum.

questions.question: What is the main use of gamma rays in medicine?
questions.explanation: Gamma rays are used in radiotherapy to destroy cancer cells.

questions.question: Which EM wave is used in RFID tags?
questions.explanation: RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) tags use radio waves for tracking and identification.

questions.question: What effect can microwaves have on living tissues if over-exposed?
questions.explanation: Microwaves cause heating effects in tissues (as in microwave ovens).

questions.question: Which region of the EM spectrum is used in astronomy to study distant stars?
options: Multiple regions including radio and X-rays
questions.explanation: Astronomers use multiple EM regions: radio telescopes, X-ray telescopes, infrared cameras, etc.

questions.question: What is the correct order of the EM spectrum from shortest to longest wavelength?
options: Radio → Microwaves → Infrared → Visible → UV → X-rays → Gamma
Gamma → X-rays → UV → Visible → Infrared → Microwaves → Radio
Visible → UV → Infrared → Radio → X-rays → Gamma → Microwaves
Radio → Visible → UV → X-rays → Gamma → Infrared → Microwaves
questions.explanation: Gamma (short λ) → X-rays → UV → Visible → Infrared → Microwaves → Radio (long λ).

questions.question: Which EM wave is commonly used for sterilising food?
questions.explanation: Gamma rays kill bacteria and are used to sterilise food and medical equipment.
